thread.title: Denver squeaks into top 10 cities for recreation
thread.title_full: Denver squeaks into top 10 cities for recreation

author: Caitlin Hendee
title: Denver squeaks into top 10 cities for recreation
text:
Denver squeaks into top 10 cities for recreation Jul 7, 2015, 11:13am MDT Thinkstock A cyclist rides on a dirt trail in Lakewood, Colorado with the downtown Denver skyline in… more With the mountains less than an hour drive away, nearly 350 miles of trails for running, biking and walking, world-class music venues and much more, Denver is renowned for its recreation. And a new WalletHub report confirms that even further. The Mile High City is the tenth best city for recreation out of the 100 largest U.S. cities, based on 27 metrics the Washington D.C.-based financial analysis site used to identify which cities are best and worst for recreation. Business Pulse Some of those metrics included number of entertainment and recreations facilities (like music venues, coffee shops, bike rental facilities and more), costs of entertainment and quality of parks (such as the percentage of the population with walkable access). Denver is: 31 st – Spending on parks per capita. 53 rd – Parkland as a % of city area. 19 th – Number of bike rental facilities per 100,000 residents. 13 th – Percent of population with walkable park access. 15 th – Number of music venues per 100,000 residents. 32 nd – Number of tennis courts per 100,000 residents. 11 th – Number of park playgrounds per 100,000 residents. 9 th – Number of swimming pools per 100,000 residents. "The characteristics of a park should match its goals in relation to overall system planning," said Michael B. Edwards , assistant professor of parks, recreation & tourism management at North Carolina State University. "Parks designed for interaction with nature, mental restoration or for physical activity may need different size, amenities and locations." He added that stakeholders should consider features, condition, access, aesthetics, safety and programming and policies related to parks and how they facilitate the outcomes they seek from the park or area. Great Outdoors Colorado recently announced that it will commit $25 million to get children outside playing . Gov. John Hickenlooper last month also created the Colorado Outdoor Recreation Industry Office, aimed at managing and expanding Colorado's $4.2 billion recreation industry . Colorado Springs was the next highest Colorado city, coming in at No. 22. Aurora was No. 74.
